intro: Hieracium hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymus's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in a single terminal head. Native to Central and Southern Europe, this species thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the hawkweed genus, with unique morphological traits that aid in its identification.
